alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 17 at 1:46AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM HST EARLY THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF MAUI IN MAUI COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The island of Maui in Maui County. * WHEN...Until 400 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 AM HST, radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain over the west Maui mountains and the southern slopes of Haleakala. Rain was falling at a rate of up to 0.5 inches per hour. Additional rain is developing off to the southwest of Maui and is expected to move into already saturated areas during the next couple of hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kahului, Kihei, Lahaina, Pukalani, Kula, Keokea, Haliimaile, Puunene, Makawao, Maalaea, Paia, Wailea, Waikapu, Haiku- Pauwela, Wailuku, Pauwela, Ulupalakua, Waiehu, Makena and Huelo. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 400 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding. A Flood Watch is also in effect until 4 am HST.
